position: Senior Legislative Assistant and Appropriations Associate
key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio
developing appropriations priorities and working with the Appropriations Committee to secure the Member’s priorities in spending bills
developing policy proposals and legislation
drafting vote recommendations, talking points, hearing questions, and speeches for related floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in committee hearings and markups
representing the Member during meetings with constituents, stakeholders, and agency officials
requirements: previous work experience with the congressional appropriations process and the aforementioned legislative issue areas
excellent written and verbal communication skills
an eagerness to work for a senior appropriator in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Prior experience advising a Member of Congress and advancing policy proposals is required

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
writing hearing statements
legislative memos
constituent correspondence
preparing briefing materials
requirements: at minimum 2 years of Hill experience as a Legislative Assistant (or similar equivalent)
a good understanding of House procedures
an understanding of developing and tracking legislative initiatives and political awareness
Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast paced environment

key_responsibilities: serving as the Member’s community representative for issues and programs within their assigned portfolio
monitoring and updating the Member and District Director on important local issues, emerging trends, and critical developments
serving as a liaison to federal, state, and local government entities on behalf of the Member’s constituents
requirements: strong interpersonal skills
ability to maintain composure and professionalism
team oriented with strong organizational and problem-solving skills
demonstrable written and verbal communication skills
a deep commitment to public service
a bachelor’s degree
previous experience working with government agencies
a demonstrated interest in public service

key_responsibilities: managing all aspects of the Member's daily and long-term schedule in DC and in the District
tracking, evaluating, and responding to invitations and scheduling requests
coordinating travel for the Member
assisting with budgeting
vouchering invoices for payment
office management
requirements: well-organized
detail-oriented
self-motivated
able to work effectively in a fast-paced office
Prior scheduling experience on the Hill or comparable work environment is preferred

key_responsibilities: drafting and monitoring legislation
preparing materials for committee hearings and markups
representing the Member in meetings/briefings
working with constituent organizations
performing other tasks as assigned
requirements: a strong understanding of the legislative process
excellent writing and communication skills
a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced office

key_responsibilities: managing the front office
coordinating tour and flag requests
managing LA internship program
supporting the work of casework staff
providing additional office support as needed
requirements: organized
passionate
team-oriented
excellent oral and written communication skills
great attention to detail
strong time management skills
an ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines
a sense of humor
Fluency in Spanish is a benefit but not required

key_responsibilities: serving as the on-the-record spokesperson and principal advisor on national and local communications strategy
managing an aggressive, proactive communications shop
writing press releases, talking points, statements, and newsletters
providing quarterly media training and giving regular, direct feedback to the member of Congress
cultivating and maintaining personal relationships with members of the local, state, and national press and strategic partners
managing a social media team
proactively conceptualizing, drafting, pitching, and placing op-eds
booking and managing television, digital and print interviews
requirements: a creative thinker who thrives under the pressure of tight deadlines and breaking news
skilled at building and implementing long-term executive thought leadership strategies
comfortable with ever-shifting vote schedules and deadlines
detail orientated
willing to work varied and unpredictable hours
dedication to public service and an appreciation for the work of the office’s legislative and award-winning constituent service team
Significant professional experience in public relations, journalism, public affairs or political communications
Experience managing a small team
A history of providing media training and communications advice to an executive
A professional track record of successfully creating and implementing communications strategies that span several media
Strong journalistic writing skills and experience with AP Style
An interest in legislative politics
Experience planning press conferences and events that generate news
Experience managing a budget
Demonstrated ability to assess news value
Experience or an interest in mentoring and developing high-performing junior staff
An interest in foreign policy and national security, transportation, and mental health issues is helpful

key_responsibilities: overseeing the Committee’s Office of Advice and Education

managing a nonpartisan staff of attorneys and other professionals which is responsible for providing a high volume of ethics advice, education, and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: a minimum of 5 years of experience with government ethics
outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
the ability to build consensus
the sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is also desirable: ethics counseling and training, criminal law, securities law, and familiarity with Congress and its unique institutional prerogatives
Previous management experience preferred

key_responsibilities: Managing and overseeing the day-to-day operations of the communications team
Fielding interview requests and actively seeking out interview opportunities
Drafting and editing press releases, op-eds, newsletters, talking points, mailers, speeches, social media content
Preparing and staffing the Congressman for media interviews
requirements: Previous management experience is preferred
Prior Capitol Hill experience is helpful, but not required
A keen sense of progressive messaging and positions also required

office: House Committee on Oversight and Reform, Democratic (Majority) Staff
key_responsibilities: working with the Chief Clerk and Deputy Chief Clerk to coordinate logistical aspects of hearings, markups, and Committee meetings
managing the Legislative Calendar, hearing documents, Committee archives, and the transcript review process

key_responsibilities: developing a strategic communications plan

key_responsibilities: producing original creative content, social media posts, graphics, videos, and written materials

familiarity with both Intranet Quorum (or related programs), Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Premier Pro, etc.), and social media network administration
2-3 years of relevant professional experience

office: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
key_responsibilities: Maintaining committee official records in compliance with House and committee rules including the maintenance of the House Repository and committee archive records
Organizing and documenting committee markups in coordination with the committee counsels
Acting as reading clerk and tally clerk, including the live posting of amendments and their disposition to the House Repository during committee markups
Maintaining legislative files, including referral of legislation to subcommittees
Assisting in the preparation and filing of committee legislative reports
Maintaining the committee Legislative Calendar and Activity Report
requirements: a minimum of four year of previous Congressional experience, ideally as a committee clerk
knowledge of Congressional administrative rules and procedures
the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects
work well under pressure
strong oral and written communication skills
the ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment

monitoring legislative developments within the House Agriculture Committee and on the House floor
staffing the Member in meetings and Committee hearings/markups

Previous Capitol Hill or campaign experience is preferred

key_responsibilities: managing and coordinating in-state and/or national media activities
preparation of materials, including background memos, press advisories, press releases, statements, and remarks
coordinating the creation and posting of digital content with the Press Assistant
assisting with the planning, preparation, and staffing of news conferences and events
maintaining relationships with local and national news media outlets
other duties related to press operations and other office responsibilities

experience with pitching to national, state and local media outlets
organized and creative
excellent time management and strong written and verbal communications skills

key_responsibilities: Managing the office intern program, ensuring smooth front office operational duties
Working with constituent services representatives to ensure efficient casework intake using the office’s internal database
Assisting persons who have appointments with the Member or other staff Members and works closely with the District Director to ensure that the Members’ appointments are on time

Assuming responsibility for overall office appearance and layout
Maintaining the office answering machine or voice mail
Screening and referring cases, when appropriate, to other offices
Logging in all incoming and outgoing mail and incoming telephone calls relating to casework or opinions
Performing other duties as assigned
requirements: impeccable judgment and the ability to prioritize myriad tasks
personable, organized, and detail-oriented
excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work cooperatively with others

location: San Rafael, Petaluma, Ukiah, or Eureka
key_responsibilities: working as a constituent services representative helping local constituents resolve issues with federal agencies
serving as a liaison to local Veterans Service Organizations (VSO)
attending local events and meetings on behalf of your Member of Congress
performing casework
requirements: None

key_responsibilities: leading and contributing to multiple caucuses, priority legislation and efforts
working closely with bipartisan stakeholders both on and off the Hill
requirements: strong oral and written communication skills
demonstrated experience advancing a legislative agenda, working with diverse coalitions, and representing Members of Congress in front of stakeholders and constituents
Several years of professional health policy experience, including Hill familiarity, is required

key_responsibilities: handling his office’s agricultural and environmental policies and lead his work on the House Agriculture Committee

formulating legislation and planning the pathway for the legislation to become law

preparation for hearings

travel to the district
constant and consistent outreach and involvement with its constituents
requirements: experience with the formulation of the Farm Bill

strong background in legislative affairs and an understanding of what it takes and a will to work across the aisle to advance bipartisan initiatives

ability to perform under pressure and possess a strong work ethic, a commitment to public service, and an understanding of what it takes to be a part of a successful team effort

key_responsibilities: Supporting implementation of media, public relations, and communications strategies for the Congresswoman

Working well under pressure, handling stress, and accepting performance-based criticism and direction
Supporting on administrative functions of the office as needed such as constituent calls and data entry
Working flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends, and performing other duties as assigned
requirements: 2-4 years of communications experience is recommended
Strong communications skills, including writing, editing, and proofreading
Understanding of print, broadcast, and online media
Strong organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple tasks at once
Knowledge of current issues and events in which the Congresswoman is involved
Ability to exercise discretion in the representation of the Congresswoman's position on policy issues
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others, including members of the press
